jparsec.astrophysics

Class MeasureElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.MeasureElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MeasureElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The most simple representation of a measure: a value, its error, and the unit.

    A value can be defined as an upper or lower limit if desired. To do that use the prefix '<' or '>' respectively.

    Common operations are allowed with two measures. If the units are different, the unit of the second measure is transformed to the unit of the main one. Error calculations are based on standard procedures, using derivatives.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this object following international conventions about error representation. For instance, the value 0.000125 +/- 0.00009 is returned as 0.00013 +/- 0.00010, taking into account the error to round the value properly. Empty String is returned in case of error. The unit is also written.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean useParentheses)
        Returns a String representation of this object following international conventions about error representation. For instance, the value 0.000125 +/- 0.00009 is returned as 0.00013 +/- 0.00010, taking into account the error to round the value properly, or as 0.00013 (0.00010) in case parenthesis are used. Empty String is returned in case of error. The unit is not written.
        Parameters:
        useParentheses - True to use parenthesis instead of +/-.
        Returns:
        The string.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean useParentheses,
                        boolean includeUnit)
        Returns a String representation of this object following international conventions about error representation. For instance, the value 0.000125 +/- 0.00009 is returned as 0.00013 +/- 0.00010, taking into account the error to round the value properly, or as 0.00013 (0.00010) in case parenthesis are used. Empty String is returned in case of error. The unit is written optionally.
        Parameters:
        useParentheses - True to use parenthesis instead of +/-.
        includeUnit - True to include the unit in the output.
        Returns:
        The string.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean useParentheses,
                        int decimalPlaces)
        Returns a String representation of this object using parenthesis instead of +/- optionally. For instance, the value 0.00013 +/- 0.00010 is returned as that string or as 0.00013 (0.00010). Empty String is returned in case of error. The unit is also written.
        Parameters:
        useParentheses - True to use parenthesis instead of +/-.
        decimalPlaces - The number of significant digits to use for the error. Usually 2 when it can be reduced to 25 or less, and 1 otherwise, but you can use here the (non-standard) value you prefer.
        Returns:
        The string.

      • getValues

        public static double[] getValues(MeasureElement[] v)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns an array with the values of a set of measures.
        Parameters:
        v - The set of measures.
        Returns:
        The set of values.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs retrieving the value of any of the values in the input array.

                          boolean includeUnit)
        Converts a set of measures to a string array.
        Parameters:
        v - The set of measures
        useParentheses - True to use parenthesis instead of +/-.
        includeUnit - True to include the unit in the output.
        Returns:
        The string array.
